title: Machine Learning - Percentiles

metadata.description: Learn about Machine Learning - Percentiles with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
What are Percentiles?
Percentiles are used in statistics to give you a number that describes the 
value that a given percent of the values are lower than.
Example: Let's say we have an array that contains the ages of every person 
living on a street.
ages = [5,31,43,48,50,41,7,11,15,39,80,82,32,2,8,6,25,36,27,61,31]
What is the 75. percentile? The answer is 43, meaning that 75% of the people 
are 43 or younger.
The NumPy module has a method for finding the specified percentile:
Example
Use the NumPy
percentile()
method to find 
the percentiles:
import numpy
ages = 
  [5,31,43,48,50,41,7,11,15,39,80,82,32,2,8,6,25,36,27,61,31]
x = numpy.percentile(ages, 75)
print(x)

Example
What is the age that 90% of the people are younger than?
import numpy
ages = 
  [5,31,43,48,50,41,7,11,15,39,80,82,32,2,8,6,25,36,27,61,31]
x = numpy.percentile(ages, 90)
print(x)

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Machine Learning - Percentiles concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Machine Learning - Percentiles effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Machine Learning - Percentiles and how to apply it in your projects.
